Author: Trendymaroon

Comment: Yea, I paid $.88 in the late 90s, south central PA. It is such a clear memory as it was dramatically less than I was paying at home, 100 miles away. Thanks to the collapse of the USSR and Russia flooding the oil market with cheap crude, I heated my house for most of the 90s decade, using kerosene and rarely paid over a buck a gallon. My local gas station has a kerosene pump. Currently, it is $5.99/gal.
